publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3671 Mr Kenneth Macintosh: Children’s Cancer Awareness Month—That the Parliament notes that December is Children’s Cancer Awareness Month; recognises the medical, emotional and financial impact that cancer and leukaemia have on children and young people and on their families, friends and carers; congratulates CLIC Sargent for its work as the only national charity dedicated solely to raising awareness of cancer and leukaemia in children and young people and providing clinical, emotional and financial support services to child cancer patients and their families, whether in hospital, at home or in the community across Scotland, and urges the Scottish Executive to raise public awareness of cancer in children and young people and to ensure that research into effective treatment of cancer and leukaemia is adequately funded.
S2M-3671 Children’s Cancer Awareness Month (lodged on 6 December 2005) Donald Gorrie*

S2M-3671 Children’s Cancer Awareness Month (lodged on 6 December 2005) Jackie Baillie*, Scott Barrie*, Sarah Boyack*, Bill Butler*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Cathie Craigie*, Bruce Crawford*, Mr David Davidson*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Marlyn Glen*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Alex Fergusson*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Ms Sandra White*, Murray Tosh*, Stewart Stevenson*, Margaret Smith*, John Scott*, Eleanor Scott*, Mary Scanlon*, Mike Pringle*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Des McNulty*, Michael McMahon*, Christine May*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Tricia Marwick*, Carolyn Leckie*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Margaret Jamieson*, Karen Gillon*, Rob Gibson*, Fergus Ewing*, Helen Eadie*, Alex Johnstone*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Robin Harper*, Karen Whitefield*, Mr Bruce McFee*, Janis Hughes*, Frances Curran*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Kate Maclean*

S2M-3671 Mr Kenneth Macintosh: Children’s Cancer Awareness Month—That the Parliament notes that December is Children’s Cancer Awareness Month; recognises the medical, emotional and financial impact that cancer and leukaemia have on children and young people and on their families, friends and carers; congratulates CLIC Sargent for its work as the only national charity dedicated solely to raising awareness of cancer and leukaemia in children and young people and providing clinical, emotional and financial support services to child cancer patients and their families, whether in hospital, at home or in the community across Scotland, and urges the Scottish Executive to raise public awareness of cancer in children and young people and to ensure that research into effective treatment of cancer and leukaemia is adequately funded. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Jackie Baillie, Scott Barrie, Sarah Boyack, Bill Butler, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Cathie Craigie, Bruce Crawford, Mr David Davidson, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Marlyn Glen, Tommy Sheridan, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Mr Frank McAveety, Alex Fergusson, Mr Jamie Stone, Ms Sandra White, Murray Tosh, Stewart Stevenson, Margaret Smith, John Scott, Eleanor Scott, Mary Scanlon, Mike Pringle, Dr Elaine Murray, Des McNulty, Michael McMahon, Christine May, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Tricia Marwick, Carolyn Leckie, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Margaret Jamieson, Karen Gillon, Rob Gibson, Fergus Ewing, Helen Eadie, Alex Johnstone, Mr Jim Wallace, Robin Harper, Karen Whitefield, Mr Bruce McFee, Janis Hughes, Frances Curran, Marilyn Livingstone, Kate Maclean, Linda Fabiani*, Irene Oldfather*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-3671 Children’s Cancer Awareness Month (lodged on 6 December 2005) Pauline McNeill*
S2M-3671 Children’s Cancer Awareness Month (lodged on 6 December 2005) Shiona Baird*, Mr Brian Monteith*, John Swinburne*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-3671 Children’s Cancer Awareness Month (lodged on 6 December 2005) Maureen Macmillan*, Trish Godman*
S2M-3671 Children’s Cancer Awareness Month (lodged on 6 December 2005) Rosie Kane*
S2M-3671 Children’s Cancer Awareness Month (lodged on 6 December 2005) Elaine Smith*
